channel.title: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling
channel.description:
[CENTER][URL=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis/][IMG]http://puu.sh/kpoJh/f094d33117.png[/img][/URL]
[B]^ Click above for source code (Git) ^[/B][/CENTER] [IMG]http://puu.sh/kpoJQ/9e5644c9b0.png[/img] Admit it; the RSPS scene has become a bit dry now-a-days.* We are becoming more of an emulation if anything. So the purpose of this? I shall keep this thread simple and to the point, two simple points:
[ul][*]An introduction to new ideas for RSPS. [*]An idea for implementation of these new ideas.[/ul]
Sui Generis [url=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis]plans to fully utilize Git and the features BitBucket offers[/url] through [url=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis/wiki/]Wiki documentation for ideas held within the source code[/url], [url=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis/issues]issue tracking to know what bugs are present, as well as propose new ideas to the server[/url], and the basic [url=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis/commits/]commits which shall allow a user to find the specifications for adding a certain content by clicking the commit ID[/url].
[I]Sui Generis is not a server that is going to be hosted.[/I]
[SIZE=3][U]Features Ready for Implementation[/U][/SIZE]
[ul][*][url=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis/wiki/Global%20Dueling]Sui Generis Wiki / Global Dueling[/url][/ul]
[SIZE=4][url=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis/issues/new]Have an idea? Click to drop it down in the issues section![/url][/SIZE] [IMG]http://puu.sh/kpruo/ceea6df508.png[/img] [SPOILER="Media"][spoiler=Global Dueling][img]http://puu.sh/kqB2c/333a87357d.png[/img] [SIZE=1]Demonstration of two players dueling in the middle of Edgeville[/SIZE][/spoiler][/SPOILER]
[url=http://www.rune-server.org/members/swiffy/]Swiffy[/url] - Using Ruse so I don't have to worry about adding generic content, rather I can just focus on the unique I want to add. [url=http://www.rune-server.org/members/brandyn/]Brandyn[/url] - Stole his thread layout because banned. [iurl=#]w/e companies logo I stole[/iurl] - because fudge making my own.
Hope I can get some motivation for this project.
Actually.. go! Comment right now with that quick reply box some motivation! This is being done for [b][I]you[/I][/b], so do it! [img]http://puu.sh/kqI2r/d10bf7c0a7.png[/img]

item.title: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Sessy Pk3r:

How is this different from the official mopar server?

[ul][li]This has content.[/li]
[li]This isn’t asking for the community to contribute code-wise, rather idea-wise.[/li]
[li]This is more aimed towards a unique approach rather than a remake.[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

item.source: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling

item.title: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[CENTER][/CENTER]
[SIZE=5][B][U]Global Dueling[/U][/B][/SIZE]

To kick start Sui Generis, I have decided to do something of relative ease to demonstrate how updates will be distributed.

[ul][*]Link to wiki: Sui Generis Wiki / Global Dueling[/ul]


[SIZE=1]Level 44? Arham 4? Coincidence? I think not![/SIZE]

[hr]

X-J-K-X:

Private servers have been around for a fair few years now, and what servers can we actually say are unique, or what has actually been created from a private server that is unique?

When I state “unique,” this is not my self-proclamation. This is based on what others describe my work as.

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:3, topic:553422”][quote]
Hope I can get some motivation for this project.
[/quote]

With that attitude I wouldn’t even start.[/quote]
Hehe, was my way for some supportive comments.

X-J-K-X:

I understand your points as to why you’re starting this, to bring fresh ideas to the community and what not, but in the end it’s all just going to be the same and then every server will end up having the exact same content, like they do now.

I have a personal goal for this too, I want to still practice my knowledge, and what better way then to add my own ideas into a server. That’s always been a joy for me, since 2013.

X-J-K-X:

However, best of luck, just an opinion.

Thank you! I don’t mind your opinion as long as you aren’t hostile.

[hr]

[quote=“fuzzout, post:4, topic:553422”]I don’t think so, honestly - The idea is good. GitHub-type systems offer branches, where if you have a great idea (or example endless TzHaar Hunger Games); one can create a branch and release it.
I feel the base should be able to serve a ‘modular’ approach (i.e. class file of a certain branch of sui generis - “sui generis: Gladiators Arena” can be self-contained, allowing the end user to just ‘plug’ the class file into the source and voila.[/quote]

Quite honestly, I was thinking about utilizing the branch system like that, with the master branch containing all of them. But I figured I’d probably mess up.

fuzzout:

I am fully supportive of the idea, I just wonder how many people in the RSPS community actually WOULD contribute, rather than pull & host.

True. I am more hoping for users to contribute their ideas through the issues section.

[hr]

[quote=“Vain_, post:2, topic:553422”]the awkward moment when you spell your own projects name wrong in your topic

[/quote]

ops, was rushing to make the image for mopar forums because my original thread was r-s

Read full topic
item.source: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling

item.title: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling
item.dc:creator: @fuzzout fuzzout
item.description:
@fuzzout wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:3, topic:553422”]With that attitude I wouldn’t even start.

I understand your points as to why you’re starting this, to bring fresh ideas to the community and what not, but in the end it’s all just going to be the same and then every server will end up having the exact same content, like they do now.

However, best of luck, just an opinion.[/quote]

I don’t think so, honestly - The idea is good. GitHub-type systems offer branches, where if you have a great idea (or example endless TzHaar Hunger Games); one can create a branch and release it.
I feel the base should be able to serve a ‘modular’ approach (i.e. class file of a certain branch of sui generis - “sui generis: Gladiators Arena” can be self-contained, allowing the end user to just ‘plug’ the class file into the source and voila.

I am fully supportive of the idea, I just wonder how many people in the RSPS community actually WOULD contribute, rather than pull & host.

Read full topic
item.source: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling

item.title: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

ruseps lol lecher 2k15

But seriously

We are becoming more of an emulation if anything.

RSPS are supposed to be emulations, of Runescape. No one is really going to create anything insanely unique and ‘wow’ with a private server. The most unique thing I’ve seen is that Ghetto online thing that was a huge hype and no one had even got close to what they had, can’t seem to find it on the forum anymore so I’m guessing it’s dead. Then there was the Hunger games rsps which was pretty unique and got a bit of attention for a while and everything else is just standard rs. Yes you can add some nice content and you can write it efficiently, but that’s not exactly unique is it. Private servers have been around for a fair few years now, and what servers can we actually say are unique, or what has actually been created from a private server that is unique?

Hope I can get some motivation for this project.

With that attitude I wouldn’t even start.

I understand your points as to why you’re starting this, to bring fresh ideas to the community and what not, but in the end it’s all just going to be the same and then every server will end up having the exact same content, like they do now.

However, best of luck, just an opinion.

Read full topic
item.source: Sui Generis | An open-source approach to spreading "unique." | Global Dueling

item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[CENTER][URL=https://bitbucket.org/Arham_4/sui-generis/][/URL]

[B]^ Click above for source code (Git) ^[/B][/CENTER]

Admit it; the RSPS scene has become a bit dry now-a-days.* We are becoming more of an emulation if anything. So the purpose of this? I shall keep this thread simple and to the point, two simple points:

[ul][]An introduction to new ideas for RSPS.
[]An idea for implementation of these new ideas.[/ul]

Sui Generis plans to fully utilize Git and the features BitBucket offers through Wiki documentation for ideas held within the source code, issue tracking to know what bugs are present, as well as propose new ideas to the server, and the basic commits which shall allow a user to find the specifications for adding a certain content by clicking the commit ID.

[I]Sui Generis is not a server that is going to be hosted.[/I]

[SIZE=3][U]Features Ready for Implementation[/U][/SIZE]

[ul][*]Sui Generis Wiki / Global Dueling[/ul]

[SIZE=4]Have an idea? Click to drop it down in the issues section![/SIZE]

[SPOILER=“Media”][spoiler=Global Dueling]
[SIZE=1]Demonstration of two players dueling in the middle of Edgeville[/SIZE][/spoiler][/SPOILER]

Swiffy - Using Ruse so I don’t have to worry about adding generic content, rather I can just focus on the unique I want to add.
Brandyn - Stole his thread layout because banned.
[iurl=#]w/e companies logo I stole[/iurl] - because fudge making my own.

Hope I can get some motivation for this project.

Actually… go! Comment right now with that quick reply box some motivation! This is being done for [I]you[/I], so do it!
